description:
This Meetup group wants to gather everyone involved in Semantic Web Technology. We will meet at opportune moments in Amsterdam and Brussels.

 

We want to push Semantic Web Technologies forward, by getting them out of their academic costumes and adopt them in industry applications. Getting together with experts - but just as well with enthousiastic interested people - to exchange thoughts can sparkle initiatives to achieve this goal.
name: Semantic Technology Benelux

description:
Self-knowledge is key to understand how we interact with each others and the world around us.


This group is how we citizens of Brussels are using cool hardware / applications / methodologies to better understand track (and subsequently understand) everything and anything about ourselves, our behaviour, the things we read, watch and hear. 

If you're a tracking hacker or just interested in the emerging movement of self-quantification, please join and share with an attentive and curious audience.

Tweet using our hashtag #QSBXL so that we can keep track of our discussions.
name: Quantified Self Show&Tell Brussels

description:
We don't know what the future of our Democracies will look like. What we know for sure though is that it will be defined at the intersection of Democracy and Technology.

The purpose of this group is to get together with people who work in public institutions and with hackers, people who can turn ideas, data into innovative applications (web/mobile/mashups/...).

Find out more on http://HackDemocracy.org
name: HackDemocracy

description: Welcome to our Belgian community about bigdata, NoSQL and anything data. If you live or work in Belgium and are interested in any of these technologies, please join! We want you!
name: BigData.be

description:
This is a safe environment to learn about lean startup execution techniques  based on peer exchange. 

Most startups fail not because they fail to execute and build their product, but because they fail to build a viable business around it. Startup is a temporary organization designed to search for a repeatable and scalable business model.

Customer development and lean startup help us do exactly this. Lean startup is a collection of techniques built around maximizing validated customer learning thought fast Build/Measure/Learn iteration loops.

We're a group of entrepreneurs taking lean startup and customer development techniques to practice in our startups. We're ready to talk implementation and share data from our experiments.

*The Lean Startup is a trademark and service mark owned by Eric Ries.*
name: Lean Startup Circle Brussels #leanbru

description:
R community in Belgium. Events, news are here !

For technical questions, a forum is accessible on http://www.rbelgium.be.
name: RBelgium

description:
Who are we?

We are the Belgium Web Performance Group. We meet monthly to discuss various topics related to Web Performance, both front-end and back-end. We are one of the local entity as you have already many in the world (San Francisco, New York, etc...)

Why is this so important?

Multiple studies have shown a direct correlation between web site performance and the bottom line:

  • +100ms → -1% sales (Amazon) *
  • +400ms → -5-9% full-page traffic (Yahoo! Autos front page) **
  • +500ms → -20% searches (Google) ***






At the same time web pages are growing at a increasing pace and getting heavier and heavier:



















This makes this topic very hot and important, especially during the economic downturn when every penny gained from higher user engagements or saved from lower hardware or bandwidth costs matter a lot.




Join our group and meet all the people who care about their sites' performance and are happy to share their knowledge, the tools, techniques, and magic tricks of web site performance optimization.

First meetings will be setup soon. Just join the group for now in order to be kept aware.
name: Belgium Web Performance Group

description: Graphs are everywhere. Got data? You've got a graph. We'll meet to learn about Neo4j, graph visualization and share experiences with real world use cases.
name: Graph Database - Brussels

description: This is the meetup group of the Agile Belgium community. We organize regular drinkups and user group meetings. Come after work and meet people you usually only meet at conferences. Anyone interested in Agile or Lean can join.
name: Agile Belgium

description: This group is the place to be for tech people to enrich their knowledge on MongoDB. MongoDB is the leading NoSQL database. So if you are interested in things like NoSQL, Big Data, schema-less design and (want to) use and explore this flexible, scalable datastore, please join us en attend our meetups.
name: MongoDB Brussels

description:
This node.js user group gathers the belgian node.js developers so we can improve our skill set and build kick-ass amazing apps.

For the time being: find us online at http://www.shadowmedia.be/nodejs/.
name: Belgian node.js User Group

description: This is a group to exchange ideas on technology, funding, business models and adoption around Linked Data knowledge visualizations and discovery as the next thing beyond traditional business analytics and intelligence. First focus on healthcare and life sciences but open to engage in other industries! Looking for passionnate and engaged members willing to share lessons learned and demonstrate showcases.
name: Linked Data Visualisations & Discovery

description:
Ruby lovers meet burger lovers. Join us to talk about ruby AND burgers in the best burger places in Brussels.

Ruby is a programming language and so this group is mostly for techies.
name: ruby_burgers.rb

description: A user group for enthusiastic Vaadin developers. We'll meet to learn about Vaadin and share experiences with real world use cases.
name: Vaadin Belgium

description: Belgian Mono users sharing their experiences!
name: Belgian Mono Community

description:
A gathering of WordPress users and professionals of all levels.

Whether you're a site owner, designer, developer, plug-in creator all are welcome to attend to learn, share and expand their knowledge of WordPress.

Have a look at our about page for a idea of the type of activities I'd like to see organised.
name: Brussels WordPress Meetup

description: Open to all those interested in Apache Cassandra, Big Data, Hadoop, Hive, Hector, NoSQL, Pig, and high scalability. Let's get together and share what we know!
name: Brussels Cassandra Users

description:
Description

The meetup aims to create a dynamic community around the topic of machine learning and more in general about the design and the use of intelligent, adaptive, smart algorithms for solving innovative and challenging problems.


We target young motivated students, researchers, programmers, data scientists, number crunchers, quants, professionals, predictors, visionaries, curious, and all sort of geeks and hackers willing to know more on how to make more intelligent applications, businesses, industrial processes and the computing world in general.
name: MLGeek Brussels

description:
Bringing puppet loving people together on a regular base, to talk about best practices, their experience and have interesting discussions about a great configuration management tool.

IRC: freenode - #puppet-be
name: Belgian Puppet User Group

description:
Do you like using Drupal? Well, so do a lot of techies in Brussels!

Let's have a cup of coffee or tea together and share our knowledge of Drupal in a comfortable and above all safe environment.

 

Membership Requirements

Language Café is a a compact group of people who like helping each other with their languages.

 

 

 

Language Café is not for everybody.

All members must meet the following requirements:

  1. Your Profile must have a clear picture of yourself.
    It can be your primary picture or one of your secondary pictures.




  2. You must complete the Introduction in your Profile. 
    Tell at least three things about yourself.
    "Hi" or "I want to learn French" is not an introduction.
    For instance, tell us about your interests, where you come from,
    how long you've been in Brussels, what you do in your free time, etc. 


  3. You must fully answer all Profile Questions.

If you do not meet these requirements, your membership application will not be approved. You are welcome however to apply again.

 

Join In

I look forward to welcoming you to our Language Café! :)

Ivan
name: Drupal Café

description:
Welcome to the Bitcoin Brussels group!

New members: please join the mailing list - all the discussion happens there!

 

The aim is to bring together people that are interested in cryptocurrencies, and mainly bitcoin; to promote discussions among people from different fields, having different background, and therefore different perspectives.

We want to create a group that would meet in a friendly and informal way, to discuss any kind of subjects related to bitcoin, ranging from technical aspects such as cryptographic concepts and bitcoin software implementation to high-level reflexions like the social impact to expect on our societies. The goal is also to find common interests to be explored further, practically creating any kind of experimentation, vulgarization, or business opportunities.

We target any kind of audience, whether you have strong expertise to share, you are totally new and curious about bitcoin, or even just want to pass by to have a beer and say hello!
name: Bitcoin Brussels

description: The Belgian Scala User Group
name: BeScala

description: Elasticsearch is the new kid on the block. A search engine built from the ground up to be distributed. Some say it goes beyond that and can (should?) replace your NoSQL stores all together. This meetup is for enthusiasts in Belgium and Luxembourg willing to share experiences, knowledge and war stories about it. If you use it, or want to learn about it - you're welcome. More information about Elasticsearch can be found over at http://www.elasticsearch.org/
name: Elasticsearch User Group BeLux (Belgium & Luxembourg)

description: This group is for anyone interested in monitoring with zabbix. All skills and levels are welcome. I started this group because there was no user group yet in Belgium. I hope with this group that we can share our experiences and learn from each other by sharing our zabbix knowledge.
name: Belgian Zabbix User Group

description:
This meetup is dedicated to the design practices, technologies, insights and opportunities around the next frontier information access - the Internet of Things (IoT). We want to cross-pollinate ideas from engineers, designers, researchers, data scientists and entrepreneurs to create meaningful and tangible solutions that will make information access more human, ubiquitous and commercially viable.

Follow us on Twitter: @n2m2m (#n2m2m)
name: IoTBE - the Belgian Internet of Things community

description:
OpenTechSchool is a community initiative offering free programming workshops and meetups to technology enthusiasts of all genders, backgrounds, and experience levels. It supports volunteer coaches in setting up events by taking care of the organizational details, encouraging coaches to create original teaching material.

Everyone is invited to participate, whether as a coach or a learner in this friendly learning environment where no one feels shy about asking any questions.

http://www.opentechschool.org/
name: OpenTechSchool Brussels

description: This is a group for anyone interested in cloud computing on the Amazon Web Services platform. All skills levels are welcome.
name: AWS User Group Belgium

description: Let's get together for some discussions about the awesome AngularJS framework! I started this group to meet the belgian AngularJS community and share together our experience.
name: AngularJS Belgium

description: Mobel, a users group based around mobile software development, design and UX. Mobel events will be organized monthly. These meetings are meant to present and exchange ideas about the challenges of developing good mobile experiences. The group will cover a broad range of mobile platforms (iOS, Android, Windows, …) and topics (Development, Technology, Design, …).
name: Mobel

description: A group for anyone interested in learning about and sharing knowledge on Laravel, the "PHP framework for web artisans". The group welcomes beginners and experts, amateurs and pros, young and old, etc. Laravel is an accessible, yet powerful framework for web application development. Its expressive, elegant syntax and its clean structure make PHP development a real joy. As the Laravel community keeps growing, this group is an attempt to get Belgium-based users to know each other, and to spread the word!
name: Laravel Brussels

description: Your new business went online yesterday and you've got a marketing budget of zero. How are you supposed to create a movement around your product? How can you get to your first thousand - or million - customers? Starting from zero, it feels impossible. Enter the growth hacker. You may not have heard of growth hacking yet, but you've certainly used the billion dollar brands built by it: Hotmail, AirBnB, Facebook, Dropbox, amongst many others. This group is for people who want to adopt the growth hacker mindset. It is all about sharing hands-on tactics that bring you results.
name: Growth Hacking Belgium

description:
The BetaGroup is a community of 6.500 Web Entrepreneurs. Regularly, they gather to listen startup pitching on stage.

The BetaTech aims at gathering the Belgian techies once a month to listen a technical talk and share about the topic.

It was initiated by Christophe, Martin, Pascal, and Yannick.

See all past events (with the link to their slides).
name: BetaTech

description: This is a group for 3D printer owners and people who want to 3D print. At 3D Hubs we help everyone to 3D print around the corner and experience this awesome technology!
name: 3D Hubs in Brussels

description: This is a group for anyone interested in developing web applications in Ember.js. I created this group because it's nice to have a local community for sharing knowledge, ideas and inspiration about this awesome web framework. The learning curve for Ember.js is not the lightest so it will also be a place to share your frustrations! Beginner or expert, everyone is welcome.
name: Ember.js Belgium

description:
Brussels is a great city. Java is an amazing platform to develop with. Wouldn't it be awesome if the two could get mixed?! Well, that's the BruJUG, a local Java User Group where passionate Java developers can, since 2010, attend presentations given by passionate speakers.

Will it be some technology expert, a "big name" evangelist, or even yourself? Let's join the BruJUG to discover what this year will be made of.

Oh! One last thing. All the events organized by the BruJUG are FREE!

You can find more information about us here: http://brujug.be

Pictures of all events are available on FlickR: https://secure.flickr.com/brujug/

Videos of divers sessions can be found here: https://vimeo.com/channels/brujug

Fastest news channel: https://twitter.com/brujug

And we are on LinkedIn!

Girls, don't forget to join http://www.meetup.com/JDuchess-Belgium/ :-)

Registration to events is required since seats are limited. You can register on Meet-up or on Eventbrite.
name: BruJUG - The Brussels Java User Group

description: This is a group of people super enthousiast about the new possibilities of the internet, open source, software defined networks and the possibilities it gives to create better companies, business models and a better world !

topics.name: Apache Lucene and Solr Open Source Search

name: SDN Networks and Open Source Integration

description: The Symfony User Group in Belgium, for Belgians, by Belgians. We speak about everything related to Symfony.
name: Symfony User Group Belgium

description: This is a group for anyone interested in Ceph ( http://ceph.com/ ). All skills levels are welcome. There is a growing user community around this Free Software distributed storage. Participants are expected to share their use cases, tips and tricks, projects, have a good time in a friendly and informal atmosphere.
name: Ceph Brussels

description: MobileMonday is a community of mobile professionals. The open community promotes the mobile industry and fosters cooperation and networking among industry-academy people and their companies by providing opportunities for personal and virtual contacts. More info on www.mobilemonday.be
name: MobileMonday Belgium

description: Meet other developers using Meteor. Share your knowledge, apps, and get feedback from others. Meteor is an open-source platform for building top-quality web apps in a fraction of the time, whether you're an expert developer or just getting started.
name: Meteor Brussels

description: This group is for Big Data Science software developers willing to learn how to use and contribute to open-source Big Data projects based on Hadoop.

topics.name: Hadoop Big Data Web Analytics Data Analytics

name: BigDataScience Hacks @ Belgium

description: This group consist of the organiser(s), or some people presenting European Puppet User Groups. By this group, we will try to keep in touch with the local user groups, and the main goal is to organize a 'European puppet user group day', a day dedicated to the puppet community. This group aims to bring together the key persons of the local European Puppet Groups. Please look (or start one) for local Puppet User Groups if you want be part of regular Puppet Groups Meetups.
name: European Puppet User Group

description:
Meet other developers and ops engineers using Docker. Docker is an open platform for developers and sysadmins to build, ship, and run distributed applications. Consisting of Docker Engine, a portable, lightweight runtime and packaging tool, and Docker Hub, a cloud service for sharing applications and automating workflows, Docker enables apps to be quickly assembled from components and eliminates the friction between development, QA, and production environments. As a result, IT can ship faster and run the same app, unchanged, on laptops, data center VMs, and any cloud.

Learn more about Docker at http://www.docker.com
name: Docker Belgium

description: Belgium's Software Testing meetup group is for Software Testing Enthusiasts who like to be up to date with the latest innovations and trends in Software Testing, but also to start with a community of Testers that would like to share their knowledge and help out their peers...
name: Belgium's Software Testing Meetup

description:
What is TechMeetups?


TechMeetups has been setup to create a global network of Tech communities from San Francisco to Sydney. We believe that Tech communities are isolated and great things can be achieved if we connect within our cities and outside our borders. Our goal is to create a global Tech cluster of over 50 inter-connected Tech communities by 2015.

Our global community started out with the launch of the London Silicon Roundabout Tech community in December 2010. Following it's success in becoming one of the city's fastest growing groups, we have launched TechMeetups communities in the following locations:

Europe: London, Berlin, Cambridge, Lisbon, Moscow, Manchester, Paris, Budapest, Belgrade, Amsterdam, Stockholm, Dublin, Munich, Edinburgh, Hamburg, Vienna & Barcelona

USA: New York, Dallas, Miami & San Francisco

Asia: Bangalore, Bangkok, Mumbai & Singapore

Others : Dubai, Sydney, Rio De Janeiro & Sao Paulo


You can see our latest list of communities here.


• Why become a member of TechMeetups?

Anyone who is thinking about starting their own software or web company and wants to bounce ideas off each other and meet potential partners or investors are welcome to join this group!

Our aim is to connect the various tech communities to help our members network, connect, invest and launch products in the hottest technology clusters. We plan to organise monthly meetups to cover various technology subjects that are of interest to our members.


• GET INVOLVED IN EVENTS WORLDWIDE on TechMeetups!

Check out all upcoming events in all our communities and promote your company in one of them!

SPONSOR| PRESENT| MENTOR



• STARTUP NEWS AND ARTICLES TechStartHub!

We compile the best Startup News & Articles from around the globe.





• POST YOUR STARTUP JOBS at TechStartupJobs!

Recruiting ? Wanting to hire that perfect team? Post your jobs on TechStartupJobs and/or take part in TechStartupJobs Fair to attract the right talent to your company.





• FUND YOUR STARTUP AT TechStartupFund!

Looking for Seed Funding to launch your Startup? Don’t want to give away any Equity ? Launch your Startup on TechStartupFund and lets get the community behind you.
name: Brussels TechMeetups

description: Let's meet and share about SEO, Social Media Marketing, Digital Marketing Strategies, Conversion Rate Optimization - From strategies to tactics and tools, what works well and what doesn't, what is coming up next, our good and bad experiences... The Meetup for Brussels Online Marketers!
name: Brussels Online Marketing Meetup

description:
The Brussels Data Science Community, is the Belgian voice for data scientists with a conscience.  If you have a desire to stay at the forefront of technological innovation & positive social change, join us.  

We use data in the service of humanity .

Once a month this community of #DataWranglers #Philanthrogeeks #CyberAnthropologists #AwesomeNerds #DataMungers #Datawhisperers #Probabilists & #BigData professionals gathers in Brussels to talk about how to drive measurable value from data and to convert data to €. 

Each month private or public companies will confront the community with one specific problem it is facing in the hope that the group can draft different paths to a solution.

It's a venue for sharing, discussing, showcasing and developing ideas for how data sciences should be used. 

We want to:

•  be a knowledge hub for data scientists, we are open to everybody. 
• Share knowledge - work on practical business cases - learn from others - have fun are some of our driving forces.

Our GOAL: 

"Our ultimate goal is to make the difference by applying our science and knowledge on social challenges."

Our members are looking for opportunities to contribute their professional skills to make a positive impact on our local community or  in the world. 

Sign up for our meetings on www.meetup.com/Brussels-Data-Science-Meetup/
Follow our community on Twitter: @DataScienceBe
Check out the job postings on our Linkedin group: http://goo.gl/jJMYQP
Follow Google+ community: http://goo.gl/ySWvhj
We have 1 follower on our facebook page !  https://www.facebook.com/Datasciencebe


We are looking forward to meeting you soon !

The Brussels Data Science Community

----------------------------------------------------------------

Who should attend:

• Business and public industry leaders  who leverage data to compete and win

• Enterprise architects, IT, data warehousing, and business intelligence professionals

• Hadoop developers, data scientists, business analysts, statisticians and hackers
name: Brussels Data Science Meetup

description:
This is a group for any freelancer that wants to share experiences being a freelancer. With UnitedConsultants, we form a community of IT freelancers, offering advice to each other and bundling forces. We try make it easier to get a fully transparent job, preferable with as few middlemen agencies as possible. On top of that we organize face-to-face meetups to discuss whatever you like. 

PLEASE JOIN our site at www.unitedconsultants.be! Many thanks!
name: UnitedConsultants

description: Health 2.0 Chapter Brussels -Ghent is a network focused on innovations in the delivery of healthcare and health related technology. This network is dedicated to creating a community around Health 2.0 in Brussels and Ghent as part of the international Health 2.0 movement. It's a venue for sharing, discussing, showcasing and developing ideas for how to improve patient care. If you are interested in the intersection of health care and information technology, this is a group for you. Technology enthusiasts, developers, students, physicians, nurses, pharmacists, patients, designers, social workers are welcome.
name: Health2.0 Chapter Brussels

description:
C'est un espace de réflexion, de rencontres et d'actions pour tous les acteurs économiques, conscients de leur rôle déterminant dans l'espace européen. 

Ce groupe est dédié à l'affirmation de la valeur ajoutée des talents issus de la Diversité. 

C'est un fait établi que les Entreprises ( Socio culturelles, les collectivités, les institutions financières ) qui font le pari gagnant de la Diversité augmentent leur productivité.
name: The Madiba Project

description: If you are interested in Agile development and the Atlassian Tool chain, this is the user group for you. Come and meet us for interesting talks and meet people and exchange experiences.
name: ABUG - Atlassian User Group Belgium

description: Appel à la communauté agile de Bruxelles ! Que vous soyez un fervent agiliste ou tout simplement intéressé par l'agilité, venez découvrir de nouvelles approches, vous enrichir à travers les nombreuses sessions proposées, participer à des innovation games et partager vos retours d'expérience lors de nos meetups "Les Mardis de l'agile" !
name: Les Mardis de l'Agile

description: A group for and by Sitecore users: Developers, end-users, sales reps etc. Our goal is to provide insight into the possibilities and limitations of the Sitecore platform. Through cases, implementations and information sessions the SUG#BE will aim at providing information on both best-approaches as well as lessons learned to provide a clear insight and understanding into this Content Management Engagement platform.
name: Sitecore User Group Belgium

description: A group of Hackers interested in learning about and building apps with Famo.us, a JavaScript platform that enables developers to build beautiful, cross-platform web apps that perform as well as the very best native apps. We will be hacking every other week by building fully working apps. Be ready to have fun all the time!
name: Famo.us Hackers in Belgium

description:
Have you ever wondered what goes on in a startup? 
Or do you want to figure out the bits and bytes of hexes and tints?

We would like to reach out to everyone interested in what we do and how we do it by organising weekly meetups; evenings where you can sit together with us and discuss, co-create or just have a drink.

There is only a limited amount of spots, since all of this will take place in our BigBoards HeadQuarters (Also known as "Daan's Garage") located in Aarschot, Belgium.

We hope to see you there and have a great evening!
name: BigBoards Garage

description: This is a group for anyone interested in front-end. All skills levels are welcome. I started this group because I'd like to meet other outdoor enthusiasts. Looking forward to explore the outdoors with everybody.
name: Front-end in Brussels

description: We are a group of software developers, ranging from noobs to veterans, who meet up regularly at different places in Belgium. We aim to spread the ideas of Domain-Driven Design, and become better Software Craftsmen, by teaching and learning. We are technology-agnostic. We are open, self-organized, and inclusive. Everybody is invited to join and participate!
name: Domain-Driven Design Belgium

description:
Let's get together to discuss the current and future wearables. Quantify yourself with fitbits, get productive with Google Glass and get connected with your smart watch. And maybe we'll throw in some sensors and beacons too.
If these are the devices you like to discuss, use or hack then this is the meetup for you.
name: Wearables Belgium Meetup

description: BRUG is the Belgian Ruby User Group. http://brug.be
name: BRUG

description: Let's talk about Groovy, Grails and other related technologies and how we can increase their adoption in enterprise and make our workplace a better place. Nothing formal at this stage! Come and share your experience.
name: Belgium Groovy/Grails User Group

description: Just an informal get together to work on IoT projects, using microsoft hard & software. Bring your netduino, gadgeteer, galileo, tessel or other device and your coding skills to build stuff together.
name: Microsoft oriented IoT Meetup

description: The Belgium Oracle Application Express (APEX) Meetup group. If you just start with APEX development or already have a lot experience with it and you want to meet with peers, this is the ideal location to do so.
name: ORCLAPEX-BE

description: Connect with local developers building on Salesforce Platform.
name: Belgium Salesforce Developer Group

description: Meet other local C++ programmers. All levels of skills are welcome in the group even absolute beginners with an interest in the C++ programming language. Network, talk shop, or just enjoy the fine beer.
name: C++ Professionals in Brussels Meetup

description: Interfeb is the International Federation of Beacon providers. Hardware, apps, software and marketing enthousiasts are more than welcome to join the Meetup group. Informal meetups will be announced here and are open to everyone. Formal meetups will be announced to Interfeb members.
name: Interfeb iBeacon Meetup

description:
We just get together and learn ourselves some Elixir for greater good.

Follow us on Twitter @elixir_be.
name: DevSpace Elixir Study Group

description:
Our program is designed for complete beginners or "half-beginners" who really want to dive into programming and, above all, change their mindset. Learn to think like a developer, consider issues with new insight, and become more creative thanks to these newly acquired abilities. Our unique goal is to facilitate becoming an outstanding entrepreneur who is able to code his/her own projects and to deeply understand technical issues.

In preparation for the full bootcamp that starts in January 2015, we'll be giving free front-end training sessions. Come & learn HTML, CSS and JavaScript with us!
name: Le Wagon Brussels - Coding Station

description:
The Circle of Code Sorceresses is a group of women, living and breathing Europe, who share a common love with programming, ICT, electronics and robotics! We are active in such fields and involved in real projects, with real technical topics. We have questions, solutions, workarounds, explanations, knowledge, creative thinking!

We are a group of women active in the programming, ICT, electronics and robotics domain. We are doing real projects and we do discuss real technical topics. We all like our tablets and smart phones, but we are not just group of "geekettes" in love with Social Networks, Facebook and Twitter.

We would like our members to have a real technical profile. Of course, we accept professionals as well as "hobbyists". If you are a mother that loves hacking Linux, programming robots or being active in FLOSS projects in your free time, you are very welcome in our group. Your level of expertise is of no importance. Just be yourself, come to learn and to share.

Our aim is to empower women in tech and inspire present and future sorceresses. We belief however that women's participation is vital to building technology that the world needs.
name: Circle of Code Sorceresses - Europe

description: You want to know more about Oracle Weblogic or you want to share your experiences, then this is your group. Let's get together to learn and of course have fun while learning.
name: Brussels Oracle Weblogic Meetup

description: Girls Code Europe is a stakeholder group with the mission of promoting digitally skilled girls of all ages across Europe. “Girls Code Europe” is an open initiative of the Digital Leadership Institute, Belgian Contact Point for the European Centre for Women and Technology, with the purpose of bringing individuals and organisations together to increase participation of girls and women in digital studies and careers.
name: Girls Code Europe

description: Gathering of IT Security people, professionals, experts, interests, sharing ideas, a drink. Talks and presentations, challenges and opportunities.
name: Belgian IT Security Meetups

description: Wanna have lunch? Wanna have a night out? Wanna talk IT stuff? Dar si mai bine, vrei sa vorbim si in romana despre toate astea? Iesim undeva pe ploaie? Vrei sa facem un sport sau sa iesim cu bicicleta? atunci esti binevenit. Even better... you work in Brussels? Atunci clar ca esti binevenit!
name: Romanian IT crowd. Travel, adventure and beer incl

description:
Passionné du WEB, développeur et chef de projet. 

Mon dicton de Gandhi : "Incarnez en vous le changement que vous voulez voir chez les autres"
name: Apprendre à programmer un site WEB (débutant)

description:
This is an English speaking group of developers and engineers that meet once a month since 2009 to share, learn and code with Android, Dart, Polymer and other Google Technologies. The main purpose is to get to know other developers and to exchange knowledge and hear about the latest features of new technologies.

Usually, the events take place weekdays in the evening. Sometimes we have full day events during the weekend. 

A typical evening event has two technical presentations about one topic and is targeted at beginners, advanced professionals and students. There is always the possibility to socialize and present own projects. 

You can find a list with all past events at gdg-brussels.org

The group is independent of Google. The organizers are not working for Google. Still, we have a good relationship.
name: Google Developer Group Brussels

description: Bonjour à tous, Je souhaite créer un Meetup pour regrouper tous les passionnés d'SQL Server et surtout ceux qui aiment l'administration. Permettre des échanges, aider à améliorer nos connaissances et même partager les offres d'emplois qui ne sont pas toujours publiées sur internet. Partager les évênements en Belgique et même en France.
name: Brussels SQL Server admin Meetup

description: Journalists sometimes call themselves “hacks,” a tongue-in-cheek term for someone who can churn out words in any situation. Hackers use the digital equivalent of duct tape to whip out code. Hacks/Hackers tries to bridge those two worlds. It’s for hackers exploring technologies to filter, visualize and distribute information, and for hacks who use technology to find and tell stories. Hacks/Hackers is a digital community of people who seek to inspire each other, share information (and code) and collaborate to invent the future of media and journalism. We want to get together and explore/create/talk about and practice the future of journalism in Brussels and beyond.
name: Hacks/Hackers Brussels

description: Hi, this is a group for Symfony2 devs and other web devs in general, that like to hang out with other devs, sharing knewledge, ideas, and generally having a good time.
name: Dutch Symfony Devs

description: What ? A half a day mini conference (in English) focused on presence and Virtual Reality called “VR.Presence.Brussels” When: 14th of November 2014 from 14:00 - 19:00 Where: The event will take place at the Microsoft Innovation Center Brussels in the European Quarter Why? Brussels and Belgium has many creative and Technical talents that need to be better informed on the opportunities offered by VR This first event will allow to create monthly meet-up.
name: Belgium VR Meet-up (Brussels)
